summary: I was driving down the street when all of a sudden my Lincoln beeps at me. it says “Service Advancetrac” and “Steering Assist Fault”. I lost all steering to my car and it swerved across four lanes of oncoming traffic until I crashed into a curb. This car almost killed me and multiple other people. The car has 79k miles on it. This should not be happening. There is a recall on 2012-2013 MKS models but not a 2014. There is very clearly something wrong with this system across MULTIPLE years. I cannot steer the car manually without straining myself. The electronic power steering has problems across EVERY YEAR. not just 2013!

Driving and stopped for a red light. The engine stalled and would not restart.I was driving and slowed down for a red light. The engine chugged and stalled. It would not restart. There was a recall on the 2013 model with the exact problem but not for the 2014. This could have ended terribly had I not been slowing down for the light. I was able to swerve into a large mall parking lot and came to a stop.

Tire size:  255/45 R 19   This is actually about all four of my tires.  I bought my tires at a discount tire in Bloomingdale, Il shop on 12/14/19.  Had 52,524 documented miles. First my tires kept loosing air.  maybe had to fill them one every 2-3 weeks, by 2020, it was every 10 days or so.  Since 2021 it was up to 2-4 times a week.  Took my car to a different tire shop today (12/3/2021) with 67,116 miles and was told the treads were pretty good but my side walls were coming apart.  Was told the tires were dangerous to ride on and have pictures of the cracks on the tires.

The contact owns a 2014 Lincoln MKS. The contact stated that while driving at an undisclosed speed, the power steering failed, and the steering wheel was stiff and difficult to turn. The failure almost caused a collision. The vehicle was towed to the dealer and diagnosed that the steering gear, front lower control arm, rear toe link and rear upper control arm were faulty and needed replacement. The vehicle was not repaired and towed back to the contact's residence. The manufacturer was made aware of the failure and referred the contact to file a complaint with the NHTSA. The failure mileage was 81,049.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LINCOLN MKS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT START-UP WHEN SHE ATTEMPTED TO START THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC AND DIAGNOSED AS FUEL PUMP FAILURE. THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE FUEL PUMP NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED. THE FUEL PUMP WAS REPLACED TWICE HOWEVER, THE FAILURE RECURRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE AND INFORMED THE CONTACT THAT THERE WAS NO RECALL ASSOCIATED WITH THE VIN.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 79,700.

I WAS GOING UP TO NEW YORK AND CAR STALLED ON BUSY I 95 NORTH HIGHWAY. I GOT IT TOWED TO MECHANIC IN NJ. HE TOLD ME FUEL PUMP RELAY MODULE AND FUEL PUMP IS BROKEN. HE FIXED IT. I CALLED LINCOLN ABOUT RECALL FOR FUEL PUMP RELAY MODULE RECALL AND OF COURSE THEY DENIED MY COMPLAINT, THEY TOLD ME THAT MY VIN IS NOT IN THEIR RECALL. ACTUALLY FUEL PUMP RELAY MODULE WAS BROKEN TWO TIMES IN SAME CAR COSTED ME OVER 1000$ TO FIX PLUS TOWING... UNACCEPTABLE AND DANGEROUS

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LINCOLN MKS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING AT VARIOUS SPEEDS, THE VEHICLE STALLED WITHOUT WARNING. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE FAILURE RECURRED SOON AFTER THE VEHICLE WAS RESTARTED. THE CONTACT STATED THAT HE HAD SPOKEN WITH THE MANUFACTURER AND WAS INFORMED THAT THERE WERE NO RECALLS ON HIS VEHICLE. UPON INVESTIGATION, THE CONTACT LINKED HIS FAILURE TO NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 14V393000 (POWER TRAIN). THE VEHICLE HAD YET TO BE SERVICED OR DIAGNOSED FOR THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE HAD YET TO BE REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 170,000.

THE DASHBOARD CONTROLS CEASED FUNCTIONING, THE HEATER CONTROLS WILL NOT WORK,MAKING THE DEFROST NOT FUNCTION. THIS HAPPENS WHILE PARKED OR IN MOTION, NO MATTER THE LOCATION. IT APPEARS THAT THE ELECTRICAL CONTROL MODULE HAS DIED IN MID-STREAM WHILE DRIVING.
PLACE VEHICLE IN REVERSE. STEERING ASSIST FAULT WARNING CAME ON. COULDN'T STEER VEHICLE.

ALL FOUR DOORS STARTED RETAINING WATER AND I HAVE TO PULL THE RUBBER BACK AND LET IT DRAIN BUT WHEN THERE WAS A HARD RAIN I WOULD GET LEAKS FROM THE MOON ROOF AREA THAT LEAKED ON TO THE CONSOLE/GEARSHIFT AREA I TOOK IT TO A SHOP BUT THEY COULDN'T FIND ANY THING WRONG THEN AFTER A HARD RAIN I SUCKED 12 GALLON OF WATER OUT OF THE DRIVERS SIDE FLOORBOARD IT SEEMED THAT IT WAS SEEPING IN FROM UNDER THE DASH OR SOMEWHERE UNDER THE FLOORBOARD BECAUSE AS SOON AS I VACUUMED SOME MORE WOULD APPEAR ALSO BEFORE I VAC I COULD HEAR WATER SLOSHING AND IT WASN'T IN THE DOORS IF THAT WASN'T ENOUGH MY WIFE WAS DRIVING AND THE MOON ROOF OPENED BY IT SELF AND WOULD NOT CLOSE  SO I TOOK IT TO A DEALER AND THEY CHARGED ME 150.00 TO CLOSE IT AND TOLD ME I NEEDED TWO MOTORS AND A NEW SWITCH AND OTHER PARTS TOTALING AROUND 700.00 AND  BUT I FELT THAT ALL THAT WASN'T NEEDED SINCE I HAD NEVER OPEN THE  ROOF BEFORE IN 4 YEARS WHICH MEANT TO ME  THE MOTORS SHOULD BE OK SINCE I HAD NEVER USED IT SO I DECLINED THE TWO MOTORS AND ASKED THEM TO PUT EVERYTHING ELSE IN AND LEAVE IT CLOSED AND I WOULD BE SATISFIED SO THEY CLOSED THE MOON ROOF BUT NOT THE SUN SCREEN AND TOLD ME THAT THEY COULD NOT CLOSE THE SCREEN BECAUSE THE ROOF MIGHT OPEN BACK UP AND THEY MAY NOT BE ABLE TO GET IT CLOSED  I PAID OUT 400.00 AND I'M DRIVING AROUND IN A BEAUTIFUL 2014 MKS  I BOUGHT IN 2015 NEW AND ONLY HAS 58000 MILES AND IN MINT CONDITION LOVE MY LINCOLN  BUT SCARED WHEN IT RAIN THIS IS A NIGHTMARE CAN YOU HELP OR TELL THEM HOW TO CORRECT THE PROBLEM

AS I WAS DRIVING STEERING STOP WORKING IT GOT SO HARD IT STEERED TO THE RIGHT ALMOST HIT A PERSON ON THE SIDE WALK.WHEN IT HAPPENED I WAS AROUND THE HOUSE.LUCKILY MADE IT HOME SAFE ON A HARD STEERING WHEEL
CAR WILL NOT START FROM STATIONARY POSITION.  FUEL PUMP CONTROL MODULE FAILURE

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LINCOLN MKS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE STEERING WHEEL SEIZED. WHILE DRIVING AT LOW SPEEDS, THE POWER STEERING ASSIST INDICATOR ILLUMINATED AND PREVENTED THE CONTACT FROM TURNING THE STEERING WHEEL. THE CONTACT HAD TO TURN THE STEERING WHEEL WITH FORCE. THE CONTACT WAS ABLE TO DRIVE THE VEHICLE HOME. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO FORD LINCOLN LONG-LEWIS (2551 JOHN HAWKINS PARKWAY, BIRMINGHAM, ALABAMA, 35244, (205)-989-3673) WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE POWER STEERING GEAR RACK AND PINION ASSEMBLY FAILED. THE MANUFACTURER STATED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 15V340000 (STEERING). THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 50,000.

8/3/2018 @ 31000 MILES A/C STOPPED BLOWING. JUST BEFORE THIS, NOTICED TEMP ROSE FROM 72* TO 85* AND HI. IMMEDIATELY DROVE TO MY LOCAL FORD DEALER. REPLACED BLOWER($400). 3MILES FROM REPAIR, THE BEEPING OF RISING TEMP OF SYSTEM BEGAN, NOT REPAIRED. I CALLED MY SERVICE REP, TOLD TO RETURN. IT WAS FRIDAY. @4:20 PM. I CHOSE TO RETURN AFTER THE FOLLOWING WEDNESDAY. I EXPECTED TO HAVE TOLEAVE THE CAR, OVER THE WEEKEND, AND NEEDED IT ON TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY. MADE APPOINTMENT FOR THURSDATY @8AM.      DIAGNOSED ON FRIDAY, 8/11/2018 AS FAULTY FCIM MODULE, AN ITEM ON BACKORDER, UNAVAILABLE, AND DISCONTINUED!  OUCH     8 MONTHS OFF OF FACTORY WARRANTY AND MY SWEET RIDE IS UNREPAIRABLE DUE TO A DISCONTINUED MODULE.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LINCOLN MKS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE INTERMITTENTLY FAILED TO START. IN ADDITION, THE VEHICLE MADE AN ABNORMAL CLICKING SOUND AND THE AIR CONDITIONER INDEPENDENTLY TURNED OFF. THERE WERE NO WARNING INDICATORS ILLUMINATED. THE CONTACT CALLED AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC WHO STATED THAT THE FAILURE COULD BE RELATED TO A MALFUNCTIONING FUEL PUMP. THE CONTACT SCHEDULED AN APPOINTMENT WITH COLONIAL FORD (120 FEDERAL RD #126, DANBURY, CT 06811, (203) 748-3503) FOR DIAGNOSTIC TESTING. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 20,000.
MAJOR WATER LEAK FROM ROOF BODY SEAM ON DRIVER SIDE.
TICKING SOUND COMING FROM FRONT OF ENGINE (TIMING CHAIN)

TSB:  16V621000    THIS HAPPENED TO MY CAR, I REPLACED THE FUEL PUMP CONTROL MODULE, THERE IS A RECALL BUT ONLY FOR THE 3.5 LITER. I HAVE THE 3.7 LITER AWD.     THE CONSUMER STATED HE PAID FOR THE VEHICLE TO BE REPAIRED AS THE VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED IN THE RECALL.  *TR

I WAS GOING NORTH ON COLLIER AVENUE IN NAPLES, FLORIDA STOPPED AT THE INTERSECTION WITH DAVIS AVENUE AT 3 PM WITH MY FOOT ON THE BRAKE WHEN THERE WAS UNINTENDED ACCELERATION. I JAMMED DOWN HARD ON THE BRAKE AND SHIFTED INTO NEUTRAL. THE MOTOR REVED UP HARD FOR A SHORT TIME, THE LIGHT TURNED GREEN, THE CARS AHEAD PULLED FORWARD, I SHIFTED INTO DRIVE, TOOK MY FOOT OFF THE BRAKE, AND THE CAR AND ACCELERATOR  RETURNED TO NORMAL AND I PROCEEDED FORWARD. EVERYTHING RETURNED TO NORMAL. I AM FAMILIAR WITH UNINTENDED ACCELERATION BECAUSE I EXPERIENCED IT PREVIOUSLY IN MY 1995 (NOT POSITIVE OF EXACT YEAR) AUDI.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LINCOLN MKS. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 16V621000 (FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE). THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE REPAIR WOULD NOT BE FREE OF CHARGE DUE TO THE VEHICLE HAVING A SALVAGED TITLE  THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE ISSUE THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE. VIN TOOL CONFIRMS PARTS NOT AVAILABLE.   UPDATED 02/21/17*LJ    *CN

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LINCOLN MKS. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 16V621000 (FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE); HOWEVER, THE PART TO DO THE RECALL REPAIR WAS NOT YET AVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE. PARTS DISTRIBUTION DISCONNECT.
CAR STOPS WHILE DRIVING AND PTS HAVE LEAKS

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LINCOLN MKS. WHILE DRIVING VARIOUS SPEEDS IN HEAVY RAIN, THE SPEEDOMETER FAILED TO ILLUMINATE AND  OBSTRUCTED THE CONTACT'S VIEW OF HOW FAST THE VEHICLE WAS TRAVELING. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER; HOWEVER, THE FAILURE COULD NOT BE DUPLICATED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 8,000.   UPDATED 02/23/16*LJ    *CN

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LINCOLN MKZ. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE MAKING A RIGHT TURN, THERE WAS A DEFECT IN THE CENTER OF THE WINDSHIELD WHICH DISTORTED THE CONTACT'S VIEW.  THE DEALER REPLACED THE WINDOW. HOWEVER, THE REPLACEMENT WINDOW WAS ALSO DEFECTIVE ON THE PASSENGER SIDE OF THE WINDSHIELD. THE DEALER AND THE MANUFACTURER DECLINED TO REPLACE THE WINDSHIELD A SECOND TIME. THE CONTACT WAS ADVISED TO PURCHASE ANOTHER VEHICLE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 2,900.
1BODY ROLL SIDE TO SIDE  .  TIRE PRESSURE ALL OK  2 THE CAR FEELS NOT SMOOTH, LIKES HALFSHIFT LOOSED.  *TR
1 THE CAR ROCKING TOO HARD AT SLOW-SPEED   2 FEELS LIKE THE HALF-SHAFT  LOOSED ' STOP AND GO NOT SMOOTH.  *TR
